alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Emmet; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 3:07AM CST until January 02 at 9:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Significant Storm With Dangerous Cold to Impact Today and Tonight... .A significant storm system with moderate to heavy snow over portions of central and southern Iowa will impact the area today. The combination of strong north winds and a dry, powdery snow will cause blowing and drifting snow and potentially significant travel problems in the areas affected. Also, bitter cold temperatures and dangerous wind chills will occur through most of the event with sub-zero wind chills expected through tonight when the coldest air of the season moves into Iowa. Dangerous wind chill values will extend into Sunday morning over most of the region. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...North Central Iowa. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Emmet; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster
